net.antidot.api.search
Class Facet

java.lang.Object
  net.antidot.api.search.Facet

public class Facet
extends java.lang.Object

Facet configuration.

Facet is used to filter on the characteristics of the corpus. Filter can be applied on one or multiple characteristics or-combined or and-combined.

Constructor Detail

Facet

public Facet(java.lang.String id,
             FacetType type)
Constructs new facet configuration with its identifier and type.

Default mode is set to FacetMode.REPLACE which allows to filter on one facet value only. The facet is also defined as FacetStickyness.STICKY (see What is a sticky facet?).

Parameters:
id - [in] facet identifier. This identifier should match facet declaration on indexation side.
type - [in] facet type (see FacetType). The type must match with the one defined on indexation side.

Facet

public Facet(java.lang.String id,
             FacetType type,
             FacetMode mode)
Constructs new facet configuration with its identifier, type and mode.

Default facet value combination is set to FacetCombination.OR. This combination type has no effect when facet mode is set to FacetMode.REPLACE The facet is also defined as FacetStickyness.STICKY (see What is a sticky facet?).

Parameters:
id - [in] facet identifier. This identifier should match facet declaration on indexation side.
type - [in] facet type (see FacetType). The type must match with the one defined on indexation side.
mode - [in] mode used when setting new value to filter on (see FacetMode).

Facet

public Facet(java.lang.String id,
             FacetType type,
             FacetMode mode,
             FacetCombination combination)
Constructs new facet configuration with its identifier, type, mode and value combination.

The facet is defined as FacetStickyness.STICKY when facet value combination is set to FacetCombination.OR, otherwise it is set to FacetStickyness.NON_STICKY (see What is a sticky facet?).

Parameters:
id - [in] facet identifier. This identifier should match facet declaration on indexation side.
type - [in] facet type (see FacetType). The type must match with the one defined on indexation side.
mode - [in] mode used when setting new value to filter on (see FacetMode).
combination - [in] combination of values when filtering on multiple facet values (see FacetCombination).

Facet

public Facet(java.lang.String id,
             FacetType type,
             FacetMode mode,
             FacetCombination combination,
             FacetStickyness stickyness)
Constructs new facet configuration with its identifier, type, mode, value combination and facet stickyness.

Parameters:
id - [in] facet identifier. This identifier should match facet declaration on indexation side.
type - [in] facet type (see FacetType). The type must match with the one defined on indexation side.
mode - [in] mode used when setting new value to filter on (see FacetMode).
combination - [in] combination of values when filtering on multiple facet values (see FacetCombination).
stickyness - [in] define whether the facet is FacetStickyness.STICKY or FacetStickyness.NON_STICKY (see What is a sticky facet?).
Method Detail

getId

public java.lang.String getId()
Retrieves facet identifier.

Returns:
id of the facet.

getType

public FacetType getType()
Retrieves facet type.

Returns:
type of the facet.

getMode

public FacetMode getMode()
Retrieves facet mode.

Returns:
mode of the facet.

isReplaceMode

public boolean isReplaceMode()
Checks whether facet mode is set to FacetMode.REPLACE mode.

Returns:
true when facet mode is FacetMode.REPLACE, false otherwise.

isAddMode

public boolean isAddMode()
Checks whether facet mode is set to FacetMode.ADD mode.

Returns:
true when facet mode is FacetMode.ADD, false otherwise.

getCombination

public FacetCombination getCombination()
Retrieves facet values' combination.

Returns:
combination of values of the facet.

isSticky

public boolean isSticky()
Checks whether the facet is defined as FacetStickyness.STICKY.

Remember that a facet can have been defined as sticky facet on indexation side. The returned value reflect only the facet configuration on reply side only.

Returns:
true when the facet is sticky, false otherwise.

formatValue

public java.lang.String formatValue(java.lang.String value)
Formats provided value so that it can be transmitted to Antidot search engine.

This method is defined to format appropriately filtering facet values according to facet type.

Parameters:
value - [in] input value to format.
Returns:
formatted value to be used along with Antidot search engine.
